meanings.definition: Swindles (verb): to cheat or deceive someone in order to obtain money or property dishonestly.
meanings.sent1: He swindles people by promising fake prizes.
meanings.sent2: She swindles her friends by selling fake products.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox swindles the other animals out of their food.
meanings.sent4: The con artist swindles innocent victims out of their life savings.
meanings.sent5: The magician swindles the audience with his clever tricks.

meanings.definition: Swindles (noun): a fraudulent scheme or action.
meanings.sent1: The swindles of the scam artist were finally exposed.
meanings.sent2: She fell victim to one of the biggest swindles in history.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie had a hilarious plot involving ridiculous swindles.
meanings.sent4: The swindles of the corrupt politician were like a dark cloud over the city.
meanings.sent5: The elaborate swindles of the thieves left everyone in shock.
